comment: He was super charismatic and funny, easy to pass if you attend class. Online textbook, easy read.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Caring--Graded by few things

comment: Professor Laposata's SCI1101 class is challenging, but engaging. Staying on top of the quizzes, tests, and textbook readings is key. I found unstuckstudy AI a helpful supplement alongside traditional study methods.

Wish I took another professor... This class in unbelievably hard for a gen-ed and extremely specific!! His lectures can be entertaining but they are long.

Pros: 
-uses bonus points ONLY IF ATTENDANCE IS GOOD
-homework is pretty easy

Cons:
-lots of reading for labs
-class is very specific and tests on lecture material not textbook material
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Lecture heavy

comment: I would stay away from this guy and this class. Good guy, but the class is not worth the stress. Yes you need to go to class and yes you need to purchase the textbook that HE wrote.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: You are only graded on 4 test, 4 quizzes, some homework. Attendance is not mandatory but it is needed for bonus questions.He does not offer extra credit, nor does he post his notes. If you are in honors you will have to read loads of extra material on top of the chapter reading that he makes everyone do for the test. Also you have to buy the book
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Grading scales sucks even though he offers bonus questions on his exams. I really don't have any issues with except for his grading scale. Yeah he offers bonus questions but unless youre getting a 100 on every single exam youre not passing that class with an A. You could pass every single exam with A's and B's and still end up with a c or b

He is actually a nice professor. His class is semi-difficult. BEWARE of exam and lab quiz 2, they are by far the most difficult of the course. As long as you stay on top of things, you should be okay.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Amazing lectures --Graded by few things

comment: 3 Exams, 3 Lab Quizzes, a Final, and Short MES Pearson homework assignments you can knock out in 10-15 minutes. Prof Laposatas SCI 1101 class, although the most time consuming class I had this semester, was truly a class I looked forward to going to. Hes a genuine, caring professor who gives great lectures and actively helps you outside of class.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring

comment: He is nice but not a great teacher. 4 quizzes, 4 tests and some online homework. Online homework is hard. Quizzes aren't too hard if you do the lab a few times but if not you're getting below a 50. Tests are pretty hard. Tells you your grades but doesn't put them in so you don't REALLY know your grade. Not a bad teacher and is good during lecture.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: He's a genuine guy, he doesn't care about students grades and he understands we are mostly fresh college students. Lectures are little information so you have to read the textbook HE WROTE. Theres 4 tests, and the final is not comprehensive. He doesn't grade much so you have you do well on what he does grade. Pay attention and make study groups.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--Tough grader

comment: Take this online for a summer class! Super easy. Did not need the book.

The only gripe that I have with Prof. Laposata is that he actively tries to trick you in the wording of his test questions, plus I just wish there were more grades available that aren't just tests/quiz grades. He makes you work hard for a good grade, but everything is open note. As long as you take detailed notes beforehand, you'll do just fine.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--Lecture heavy

comment: If this is online dont take it. He doesnt teach and youre expect to learn everything by yourself. Also you are forced to purchase his textbook. I got a good grade but would warn anyone of taking this course with him.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy

comment: Dont waste your time or money. He makes you purchase his own textbook and doesnt care about you or the grade you will receive. For a class that is basically common knowledge he finds a way to make it difficult.
rating_tags: Graded by few things

comment: He wrote the textbook so he knows what he is talking about. Tests can pull from small things in the textbook, but is also not too hard. Do the lab assignments because those lab grades are huge. Initial unit quizzes are very easy. Online activities are simple and straight-forward. Class wasn't too hard, but kind of a pain.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Get ready to read

comment: if this class is only available online do not take it. no zoom calls, expects you to learn by yourself off powerpoints. no classwork only tests and quizzes.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy

comment: Literally one of the hardest classes I've ever had to take only because Laposata doesn't care about whether or not you pass his exams. Made us buy the book but then used online resources for the whole course. Several answers on his quizzes and tests would be wrong. He literally didn't care.
rating_tags: Test heavy--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: Professor Laposata wants you to do well in his class and gives you the tools you need to do so, you just have to choose to use them. There are four tests, four lab quizzes, and some easy online homework. A lot of test questions are directly from the lectures so coming to class is a must. Laposata is a good speaker, making his lectures interesting.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Gives good feedback--Lecture heavy

comment: One of the better professors at KSU. He knows most students aren't Science majors and makes the class understandable for those who aren't fond of Science in general. Four tests based on lectures and chapters from the textbook. If you study, you should get an A on all of them. Four Unit homework assignments, also easy.
rating_tags: Respected--Graded by few things--Amazing lectures

comment: Hands down one of the best professors I've had at ksu. He understands that most students taking the course are not science majors. Keeps lectures interesting and is very funny throughout.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Hilarious--Amazing lectures

comment: I took him for both 1101 and 1102 and made a high A in both. If you try even a little bit its an easy A. The majority of people in there don't care at all about science and he understands that so all the material in the class is very basic and doesn't go into much depth. Great class to take to help your GPA.
rating_tags: Respected--Clear grading criteria--Hilarious

comment: Super funny and entertaining, knows how to make a lecture class less boring than usual. The content wasn't very hard, but if you don't attend class it will reflect on your grade.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: he makes the lectures a lot of fun and is SUCH a fun and energetic person. he knows most of the people taking his class arent gonna be scientists so hes pretty relaxed. i actually have had him 2 semesters for 1101 and 1102 but make sure you go to his class otherwise you will not do good on the tests. they arent hard, but 90% is based on his lect
rating_tags: Amazing lectures--Inspirational--Get ready to read

comment: 4 quizzes and a test every unit. You are allowed to use the internet and most questions are on quizlet. Didn't interact with him much but he posts every week in the discussion board about the upcoming week. Lots of text to read.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Test heavy

comment: I did well on a lot of his quizzes and tests. There are 2 quizzes every week, but most of the answers are easy to find either online (which is allowed) or in the book. He drops 3 of your lowest quizzes and your lowest test score at the end. I liked the consistency of the class and the set schedule.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment: Terrible.
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: I absolutely loved this man. He was a great professor. He was very personal with the class and he really knew his stuff. You have to come to class or you won't get the notes. Also you have to buy the textbook because he references it and he also wrote it. I would take it again in a heartbeat.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious

comment: I took this course online and it was difficult to say it was a SCI 1102. He gives you 30-60 pages of material to read and only 5 questions with a 5 minute time limit on the quizzes which doesn't give much room for error. He does drop your lowest exam and 3 of your lowest quizzes. He is the co author of the textbook also
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Come to class and write down everything in his presentations and you will be fine. He does post the lectures online but leaves out key points that may or may not be on the test. READ THE SCIENCE BEHIND THE STORIES AND CASE STUDIES. They will ALWAYS be on the tests. Do the labs, no way around getting a good grade on the lab quizzes. Not that bad.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: If you put in the tiniest effort in this class you will pass. Do the readings and don't skip.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: He's really funny and a cool guy, but I had to drop his class. He wrote his own book, and the tests and labs are super difficult. Expect to do lots of work for this class at home that you don't actually turn in, but need to know in preparation for the tests. Please save yourself and don't take him unless you're a science major.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--TEST HEAVY

comment: I took Laposata for SCI1101 but liked him so much I took him again for 1102. His grading criteria is very straight forward as is the material, but you have to go over your notes and read! I got into an awesome class where we made and shared quizlets, I would recommend doing the same, even if it's only for yourself. Quality teacher, good material
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: I took this class as a summer course and I was prepared for a lot of work. However, this professor gives 2 quizzes a week or 1 quiz and 1 test a week. The quizzes and test are very specific and he does not give you enough time. If you do not have the chapters or 3/4 PDFS memorized before the quiz and tests you will not make an A. Do not take.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: He's such a funny teacher and he's got some great stories. Lecture heavy and the tests can be kinda tricky. Make sure you get in study groups and start a group me. If you are organized and focused, you'll do fine in this class but make sure you read the textbook. Before the test, he does a review and tells you what to study and focus on.
rating_tags: Respected--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: The iconic Matthew Laposata. The man himself. The textbook writer. He's a cool professor and knows how not to bore you to sleep, but a lot goes into his tests. Read the case studies, science behind the stories, online homework, and do the labs. Overall, tests are difficult af, but if you read what you're assigned, you should do well.

He seems pretty cool and I enjoyed the class, but the tests are so hard! You have to make an A on almost everything to be able to get an A in the class which was hard because of the labs. The labs were terrible and the hardest and worse part of the entire class. Im glad to be done with it.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Tests are tough--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Easy class if you do a few things: attend every single class so you will know what he is talking about on tests based on lectures, do the online hw ( so easy), study the notes, read the case studies, science behind the stories, and do the labs!!!! 3 tests and the final .The lab quizzes (4) only have 10 questions so read it and do it!
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Gives good feedback--Hilarious

comment: If you love your GPA DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS. By far the worse professor I've had and it was an online class you would think it would be easy. Yeah right. The man wrote the textbook (in which we barely used) but you need it for graded assignments. Tests are hard and don't pertain to any of the material given. I repeat take a different teacher!!
rating_tags: Tough Grader--TEST HEAVY--Tests are tough

comment: The worst professor I have ever had. His quizzes are 10 questions in 5 minutes and his test are even harder. The class final average was a 72%. I honestly do not recommend him. I'm really good a science but he made it very impossible for most to pass. If you take him good luck.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--Tests are tough

comment: Professor Laposata brings life to environmental science! His presentation are clear, simple, and enjoyable. He is very approachable and answers all questions to the best of his ability. If you read the material and do the work, the exams and labs are a breeze. If I could've taken his 1102, I would have! I highly suggest this Professor!
rating_tags: Respected--Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures

comment: Puts some of the material online but to do really good on the tests you need to show up to every class and take good thorough notes as well as read in the books and be sure to do the labs because the lab quizzes are difficult.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: Horrible the hardest class I've ever taken so I withdrew from his class his test and quizzes are over 4-5 documents 5-15 plus pages long. I recommend take any other professor how quizzes are 5 questions in 10 minutes. Good luck
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Matt wrote half the book you use in this class, this may seem like a bad thing but what I found is that he really loves what he teaches and is great at conveying the material in a way that is as unbiased as possible. The man has jokes. Need to read the few sections in each chapter for the test to get a good grade. Need to do the labs.  Great dude.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Hilarious--TEST HEAVY

comment: He's cool. The online labs are the hardest part. He gives study guides and always gives time to ask questions the class before the test.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Didn't know anything about Matt before going in. He turned out to be my fave teacher this semester, even with a lot of other good ones. Science isn't my strong suit necessarily, but he killed it and I enjoyed the class. Has a funny, interesting style of lecture. The slides he uses are really concise so the notes aren't bad and contain good info.
rating_tags: Respected--Amazing lectures--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: He is a very funny guy that makes learning the lectures bearable. He wrote part of the class textbook and will test you on parts of the reading. Very important to read what is assigned if you want to do well on his tests, which are pretty difficult. The lab quizzes can be a little tricky sometimes, so read the labs carefully.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Mr. Laposata is a very good professor who makes environmental science very interesting. If you want an A, I would recommend going to class every day, but if you go twice a week you can probably get away with a B. Lectures were very good. Very Fair grader. Great at posting grades on time, usually know test scores two hours after taking a test.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: He is an awesome professor. Lectures were entertaining, even for a boring material. His tests were tough if you didn't go to class because he would throw in some questions that you had to be at class to know, but other than that, his class was awesome. Lab portion of the class was a breeze. Highly recommend.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Writing this review a couple of years after I had Laposata. My only regret is that I never took him for anything else. Very likable guy and, most importantly, very passionate about the subject that he teaches. The most important characteristic in a great professor is that they inspire their students and make them WANT to learn more. Just awesome.
rating_tags: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--Inspirational

comment: He was an AMAZING professor, clear grader and so smart.  3 tests and 1 non cumulative final. Lab quizzes the days after the test, online homework (super easy and short). That's literally it. He is so hilarious and handsome too. Go to class as his tests are lecture heavy and make sure you read SBS, case studies, & outside read. Easy A if you try. :)
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Hilarious--Amazing lectures

comment: He was very specific and I think too hard to be a first year, prerequisite class.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--Amazing lectures

comment: Laposata was one of my favorite professors. The class is very structured, so you won't ever be surprised with anything. There is no attendance policy, but it's important to go to class because his tests are mostly based off of the lectures. He makes the lectures fun; he is sarcastic and hilarious. 10/10 would recommend.
rating_tags: Respected--Hilarious

comment: Okay, don't listen to the people saying this class was hard or awful. He is hilarious, he's just like Dr. House. If they did poorly, it's because they didn't read or do the easy labs, which isn't a lot, but HE TELLS YOU EXACTLY WHAT TO READ. He gives major hints. He just doesn't put up with disrespect and laziness. I recommend him strongly.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious--TEST HEAVY

comment: Great professor for a profoundly boring subject. Very straightforward and reviews the course schedule every class. Online easy graded homework due before each exam. Lab quiz (10 ?'s) Exams (30 ?'s with the opportunity for class to earn an extra 3). Exams are detailed, but not hard. If you listen in class and read  the text, you will do well.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious

comment: I had Laposata in person and for an online class, I reccommend the regular lecture class. The quizzes/exams for the online class are somewhat diffifult, but the real catch is that they're only 5 questions. So it's really easy to bomb the quizzes.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--TEST HEAVY

comment: Be ready to read the textbook in and out, the little things always find themselves onto the tests.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Entertaining professor. He reminds me of House MD. He very stern yet he's genuinely funny enough to ease the pressure of his demand for respect. He'll shush you if you talk in his class (it bounces off the lecture halls' walls). Anyway, his class is easy if you attend and read the book (which he helped write) and the homework's online. Do the labs!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Hilarious--Amazing lectures

comment: This dude mad funny and the class is easy if you're good at science like me

The class was way too difficult for an online general education class. He can be very condescending in his emails. Some of the questions on the tests and quizzes are relative and doesn't really ask for a specific answer. MAKE STUDY GROUPS!!!!!
rating_tags: Tough Grader--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: I loved having Laposata. He is HILARIOUS first of all (very sarcastic), and his lectures are interesting. He tells you straight up what's boring. He gives 1-3 bonus points on all tests, depending on the classes behavior, and I've made 100s on all of them. He tells you exactly what will be on them. Just READ WHAT HE TELLS YOU TO. It's not a lot.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria--Hilarious

comment: This class is easy IF you read the science behind the stories, the labs and the other parts that he tells you to read. Pay attention to his lectures and take good notes and you'll be golden. Its not an easy A but you can definitely achieve one. His lectures are very entertaining. I loved him!

4 tests and online mastering which is very easy. His tests are extremely tough and highly detailed, don't expect to get an A in this class, his class is designed to get a B. Study and go to class and this shouldn't be very difficult to do.

His tests are very confusing and it is hard to know what his tests will be on because he will tell you to study EVERYTHING (which isn't helpful at all). Also, he doesn't drop your lowest test grade like most teachers do (you'll have 3 tests and 1 final) and don't expect extra credit except for the one assignment at the beginning of the semester.

Overall, a good teacher who is consistent at being responsive in an online class. He drops the lowest grades and is always updating with useful feedback to help with tests and quizzes.  Would take his class again.

A lot of people give him bad reviews but it's probably because they don't try. His tests can be hard because they are specific, but all you have to do is read and show up to class! Pay attention to examples and take good notes. I recommend him to anyone taking Environmental Science because he's funny and you learn a lot if you listen.

He was a great professor who made Environmental Science interesting, enjoyable, and tolerable. All tests and quizzes are multiple choice, but are hard if you do not study at all. I made straight B's on all of the tests by studying and some labs ... didn't do so hot on, but nonetheless it was a great course to take! Easy B, gotta work for that A!

If you're wanting to take his online class for SCI 1102, DO NOT do it. I repeat DO NOT even sign up.  This professor does not give Powerpoints, nor does he clarify what he actually wants.  His online quizzes are 10 minutes each, and the questions are irrelevant statistics. He wants you to read every detail of the book he wrote. NEVER AGAIN.

He really isn't that bad. Tests aren't hard if you go to class and he tells you what to study for the in his review sessions at the end of class.  You should not fail if you go to class and read the little outside stories in the book.

He gives about 4 tests and some labs. The test questions come straight from his power points. So show up and take note or you won't pass. You don't have to do the labs necessarily, but just know the material from them for the quizzes. He is a great professor and very funny and entertaining. I did enjoy the class.
Very good professor. His tests can be tricky but he warns you ahead of time. He makes the lectures easy to understand and fun with his great sense of humor.

pretty tough class honestly. I would study all week for his exams. Even though his tests are difficult and you have to cover all of your bases, he's a good speaker and my class enjoyed his lectures. Don't expect extra credit or grade bumps.

I loved this professor. He read off and explained powerpoints that he gave us time to copy down (didn't even talk while we were writing). As long as you go to class,, do the labs, do the online activities, and anything else he says you should do you should get an easy A or B

Tests are short but it's too much content to remember. Labs are long and boring. Case studies and Science Behind story was long. He's funny BUT he's full of BS when it comes to grading. DOES NOT GIVE ANY EXTRA CREDIT.
Don't take him please . My advice. especially online, he makes it so hard than a major class i studied all the modules and still struggled. don't take him

He is honestly one of my favorite professors so far. He is hilarious and I love his lectures. I would absolutely recommend. Plus, he is pretty good looking. I will say the tests can be difficult if you do not read nor attend class.
He is probably the best science teacher I have ever had. His lectures are hilarious. His tests are tough, but if you show up to class and take notes, you can get an A.

As long as you show up to class and do the assigned readings, you will be FINE! People who claim his tests are hard, don't read. Just do the small assignments online and come and jot down notes and listen, and you will do great. I never go anything lower than a B in that class.

LOVED Laposata. He knows his stuff (wrote the textbook) and I always looked forward to coming to this class. I'm not a science person but he made everything so interesting and understanding. 3 multiple choice tests and lab quizes. Don't actually have to do the labs, just know the concept. Reading the textbook helps. TAKE HIM
Tests are detailed. You have 4 exams. Labs are optional but content is on exams.

Dr. Laposata is fantastic, but don't take the class if you won't study. On the first day he tells you that his tests are hard and exactly how to get an A. Know what he puts in the study guides, and for goodness sakes read the case studies, and you will make an A. Also, he's funny so he makes a potentially boring class enjoyable.

Read the assigned material do your homework and make sure to participate in the discussions in a timely manner. If you can post on the discussion board daily then do so. He is there if you need him. You will definitely have to work for an A.  He also gives extra credit.

By far one of the worst professors I have ever had at KSU. When he answers his emails, he is very rude and absolute no help. Make sure and read the whole rubric over and over again. Do not expect him to be understandable or give in. Lastly, if you can pick a different professor than this guy do it. Coming from a struggled student.

The course layout was very organized. If you do exactly as outlined in the course syllabus, that is read the material - save it as pdf file on your computer for quicker access, do the discussions: there are 2, but you're graded on one, do the MES homework assignments which is very easy, and Extra Credit quiz, you can get an A or B in this course.

10 Quizes & 4 tests, 1 extra credit quiz, 1 quiz grade dropped. The end times vary for every test & quiz which Is crazy confusing & I missed 2 Quizes because of it & a test. Don't bother asking for make up even with valid excuse.

Study and read what he tells you!! There are 3 tests (90 points each), 3 lab quizzes (30 points each), the final (120 points), and homework at 54 points. He gives up to 3 bonus questions on the main tests based on class behavior. His lectures are very interesting though, and he makes them fun. Not to mention he is attractive, ladies.

What he teaches from the lectures are on the test.  Pulls questions out from each lecture he teaches that day for tests.  Every test there is extra credit if the class participates.  I never read the chapters he assigned  but he highlights in his reviews what to read.  His test's are relatively easy if you look over the notes a day in advanced.

Laposata is one of my favorites. Show up to class. That's huge. Just read your notes a few times a day for the week leading up to the test and you'll be fine. Make sure to read the science behind the story and case study pieces! Lab quizzes can be passed without actually completeing the lab. Just make sure you know what you were SUPPOSED to do.

So here's the thing, he's a GREAT instructor. No lie! And he has a great sense of humor too. He definitely makes the course enjoyable w his knowledge. But, it's not an easy, breezy course. U MUST COME TO CLASS BECAUSE ALL OF THE NOTES ARE LECTURE BASED!! Unless u have a friend that can hook u up. DO THE LABS. STUDY THE LABS. And read EVERYTHING.

Prof. Lap is a cool dude. A lot of people complain about him bc they don't study the right material and are surprised by questions on the test. There is quite a but of reading but it's pretty interesting stuff so I found it enjoyable. You MUST go to class and MUST take good notes. Skip a class and you won't know a few questions. I would recommend.

Not sure why Laposata is getting so many bad reviews. I actually think he is really great- I'm just awful when it comes to science. I'm still currently in the class and I should have withdrawn when I had the chance because I've borderline failed every test. However, if you just go to class, take notes and read, that's really all that's  to it.

Alright, this professor thinks he is the smartest individual to walk the face of the earth. He's arrogant and self-centered.. I took this class to just not a gen ed. class out of the way and I prepared more than usual for the first test (Im an A student) and I have never withdrawed from a class until now.. I failed my first college test ever here!

This is the worst teacher I have EVER had. Because of this class my gpa dropped from a 3.75 to a 3.31. He freaking sucks. I would not advise anyone to take this class. His tests are so impossible and irrelevant to the information gone over in class. DO NOT TAKE HIM IF YOU CAN HELP IT!!!!

Quality professor. Extremely efficient with your time, skilled in elaborating on the applicable significance of the material, and perfectly clear in outlining every expectation. To get an A: go to class, take notes, study notes, read the few extra posted articles. Once you have your rhythm, the class is an enjoyable breeze.

This class was one of the most interesting classes I have ever taken. He is very knowledgable and funny, but his tests are hard. GO TO CLASS, take good notes- he doesn't post anything online. DO THE READINGS, watch the videos. Take note of any numbers because they are on tests and very specific. If you do what you're supposed to, you'll do well.

He is very rude  for no reason, His tests have nothing to do with the material you learn.  And he doesn't give pointers to help you study. The quizzes dont even tell you the correct answers at the end. i dont see how anyone could get anything out of this class. AVOID IT IF YOU CAN! i had a 4.0 until i took his class

This teacher may seem easy, BUT don't let that fool you. He gives very lengthy ready assignments, but out of the dense reading maybe a hair of the information will appear on the test.  16 quizzes you get the drop the lowest OH and only five questions on the test. Have fun and know your stuff.

This is one of the worst prof.  to take for a Gen. Ed. class. He gives a RIDICULOUS amount of readings, 2 quizzes a week, a test every two weeks, and 3 discussion topics that require a minimum of 13 postings for each  topic. He isn't very clear on the instructions for the discussion & most of my class failed it. DO NOT TAKE. You'll thank me later.

He makes it clear that the tests will be based off lecture, and from certain small sections of the text. He gives study guides. If you study like a college student you will get 90s and up on the tests. Also there is easy online HW only due before each test, labs (not graded) and lab quizzes that you can basically just read the labs and pass. easy A

Worst professor I've ever had. The online class was insanely hard, and he offered no help. He makes quizzes due mid week at noon, so if you have to work or have other commitments you better get them done early. He drops the 3 lowest quiz grades, but that's about all the help you'll ever get from him. Never take this class. Your GPA will thank you.

DO NOT TAKE HIM. I have literally slaved for this class all semester long, putting my other classes on the back burner just for him. I attend class regularly, read assigned materials, and I have been to him for help multiple times. His study guides are not relevant and he is very vague when you ask for help. DO NOT TAKE!!!
You need a book to read the case studies and such, but overall, he gives all the info needed in the lectures. Make sure you do the labs.

This professor is very sarcastic and includes loads of information on 30 question tests.  There are 4 test and 4 lab quizzes plus homework online.  He offers SOME extra credit but don't count on it.  He requires you to buy the book even though you barely use it because the test is based off his power points which he does NOT post online. Easy A? NO

Professor Laposata's class is not easy by any means. The tests are really hard. If you don't show up to class you will not pass. Most of the test material is on the slide shows. BUT He's really funny and makes his lectures enjoyable.

This class is easy if you come to class and pay attention. He doesn't put his notes up, so don't skip class. The tests are not completely impossible, but some of the questions make you think. Be sure to do the labs and read outside material that is assigned. Overall, he's a good professor. I would take him again.

Comes off as a laid back, cool guy until time for tests or quizzes. Expects you to know 30+ pages of material based on a study guide that covers about 34 of the test, leaving you to guess what other parts you need to study. Puts questions on the test that he might have slipped in a lecture that you wouldn't expect to be on a test.
He is the worst! He is not helpful, the test are worded to confuse the crap out of you. The lectures are long and boring. He offers no help at all! He is extremely rude as well.

This class was great! Professor Laposata gave engaging and interesting lectures, so all you have to do is show up, pay attention, and take good notes. The tests are hard, but if you do the online work and look at the case studies in the book, you should be fine!

Easily the best teacher I've had at KSU. And I'm not a science major. This guy is exemplary. He teaches clearly, interestingly, and most importantly, boils it down to why it matters. A great thinker, speaker, and administrator. If you can, take his class.
Very helpful and all you have to do is show up to class and pay attention. The tests are challenging but he tells you everything you need to know and study for a couple days and you will do great!

People who are giving Laposata a bad review obviously didn't listen or study. He clearly stated what was expected REPEATEDLY. Yes, his tests are somewhat difficult, but if you study well, it's not that hard. Tests consist of lectures, labs, and case studies in the book.

Not sure why some people are giving Prof. Laposata bad reviews. He is a great teacher and the class is an easy A. Yes, you do have to study. Yes, you do have to attend class. Not because he takes attendance, but because he tests on the lectures. He will not curve any grades but as long as you attend class and study you shouldn't need him to.

OKAY soooo... his lectures and class was cool BUT TESTS WERE IMPOSSIBLE!!!! DO NOT TAKEEEE HIMMMMM!!! he couldn't care less about his students and the fact some happen to probably only need his class to graduate smh MY FIRST D! Thanks -______-

He's the worst kind of person. He doesn't care about his students and his tests are ludicrous. I'm a great student. He doesn't care at all about effort and he changes his times and grading sporadically. DO NOT TAKE HIM.

Funny guy. Easy going, but test are close to impossible. I made A's in science in high school, and is probably my favorite subject but the class is tough. The test are made to trick you. 40 questions. 10 of them labs. 5 or so from the book and the rest are from the lecture. TEST ARE TOUGH! Great guy, hard class.

I thought he was a great professor. If you attend class and actually pay attention you will make at least a B in his class. I never did the labs but seemed to make high B's on all the tests. Make sure you know the procedures to the labs and read the case studies in the textbook and you;ll do fine in the class.

This class was pretty easy as an online class. Just make sure you read the articles/book/PDF before you take the tests or quizzes. I pulled up all the info on separate tabs and did CTRL+F for the answers! Super easy! Love the fact he let you drop 2 quizzes and 1 test!
If you're not good at test taking don't take him. Only 4 tests make up your grade. The labs have to be self taught and they are on the tests.

Laposata is probably the best science teacher for SCI 1101. Hes a cool, funny guy. His lectures are interesting, and he's not strict on laptops and cellphones. However the tests for his class are ridiculous. You can study and know the material, and still get caught on a stupid question like "what was the name of the website used in the lab"

AWFUL! Do NOT take this teacher! I had to study for this class at least 10 times as much as my 4000 level classes. Made A's in 3 of my 4000 level classes this semester and a B in his class. Uses other websites and podcasts way more than book, no matter how much you study you NEVER know what will b on exam. No study guide. WORST CLASS EVER at KSU!

Self taught class. He relied entirely on podcasts, studies, etc. to do the teaching for him. 10 min quizzes, 50 min exams based on random statistics pulled from the content and no study guides at all. Easy to forget the MES as they were never linked to class. More likely to get help from other students and requirements at times unclear. Avoid!

Great professor! Anyone can do very well in his class as long as you attend class and pay attention to lectures, at least read over the labs, and do the other outside reading. Be literally tells you everything you need to know so you'll do well if you pay attention!

Dr. Laposata is funny, and his lectures are engaging. Exams have random VERY specific questions, but if you read the stuff he says to (not entire chapters), attend class, and are fairly familiar with the labs, you'll do fine. Read exam questions carefully--some seem intended to trip students up.
Tests require a lot of studying and reading of any articles and stories in the book. Lab quizzes can be difficult if you just skim the material. Just study a lot, and you will do fine. I got a B.
He's awesome! Take him he's a hottie and a great professor.

AWESOME PROF.I loved listening to him lecture. He's so entertaining and witty. Has fun with the material so it's never boring, not to mention he's a cutie n nice to look at. Lots of work/READING but if u do all the labs, all activities, come to class, study ur notes, then it's an easy A. Exam quest. r easy as long as u do ALL the reading!

Avoid if you can. This guy takes teaching a basic core science class too seriously and he comes off like hes full of himself. Irrelevant articles that were published years ago, pod casts, 50 page pdfs, a ton of statistical data all crammed into 10 minute quizzes and 50 minute tests.

Pretty straight-forward class. He is very nice and entetaining. I am taking him again next semester for 1102. And he is a pretty good looking guy, who always wears the nicest shoes. I know that that doesn't matter but thats what Im always thinking.

I got an A in the class. It's NOT that bad. He clearly structured this in a way where those who 1)attend class 2)actually DO the labs and remember the content  3)Read the Behind the Stories do better than those who don't. If you do these three things AND study notes/PDF files, you will make a good grade. It's called effort, in this order.

K,overall,the class is interesting,& professor is very hot,entertaining, & funny at times.However,it seems like he  does everything to fail a student.His tests are extremely hard and very tricky!Watch out!Do NOT in any circumstance miss his class;not b/se he counts attendance(he does),but b/se you will miss a story or a movie,& u are doomed.

this is seriously the worst teacher i have ever had in the 20 years of my life. Dosent care about his students and if you need the slightest bump to pass the class, he wont give it to you. First D in my entire life and i worked hard. KSU needs to get rid of this guy. I know many students feel this way.

DON'T TAKE HIM!!!!!!!!!!!!!! He's very unhelpful, tests are extremely hard, he is just horrible. I asked if he could email me the notes after I was out sick IN THE HOSPITAL and he said absolutely not even though I had drs notes. If you value your GPA at all, do not take him, find another teacher.

The material itself is not hard at all, he just makes it harder than it has to be. He puts random questions on the tests that nobody cares about and have nothing to do with science just to make it miserable for everyone else. Take a different professor, this guy is horrible.

Two 5 question, 10 minute quizes a week that require you to read 5 50 page pdfs. 1 test every 3 weeks 25 questions 1 hour. 1 hw at every test. And 3 discussions grades them so it's impossible to pass. He drops your lowest test grade and 3 of the 16 quizzes. The questions on his examinations are not simple to find in the pdfs or on google anywhere.

The class materials were rather easy, the way the teacher sets up his class is not. I took it online and there were a million due dates and readings to keep up with. I would miss due dates bc I couldn't keep up. Two quizzes a week with hmwk. He grades his discussions very harsh you need to post 100 educated post to pass. I do not recommend him.
He's not that bad, but he's definitely not easy. There is no room for mistakes. There's only 3 tests and that's your grade. His questions are very detailed and you can confuse yourself.

He is funny and the material itself is not hard. You just have to find ways to keep yourself interested. The labs are really annoying and the tests to me were not too easy so I had a hard time in this class. I recommend him if you are good at taking tests and are willing to do those labs. There aren't too many grades in here, so be careful!

I am not sure why so many people are saying he is bad. He is a great professor that makes class etertaining. He tells you exactly what to study. I hate science and I got a A for the first time in science. Take notes, do the study guide, labs and you will do fine.
Summer Online Course.  Lots of reading.  Lots of studying.  Ensures you will read all materials.  Great information.  Just follow instructions... to the the 'T'.

This professor is an absosulte clown. He is an intigent person, but he also has some major authority issues. This professor is an arrogant control freak. I made an 89.95 according to his grading scale if you calculate it as a percentage. I was A on everything but I feel he penalized me on the discussion because he did not agree with my views. AVOID

Assignments in this class were overly tedious, and tests were very focused on seemingly unimportant details. Overall, this professor seems to be very intelligent, but he's very unhelpful. He could use some guidance in how to teach effectively. I would not take him again as I prefer not to be condescended to when I ask questions.
DO NOT TAKE THIS TEACHER. He is unclear about assignments. The tests have too much information and are extremely tedious for no reason. He will hurts your GPA! Don't do it! Especially online!

Professor was very rude and unclear about assignments. His tests were never about the topics/big ideas, only about little unimportant aspects of the subject. He took close to two weeks to reply to several of my emails, and is all around a terrible professor (especially in an online class)!

TERRIBLE online teacher! I took this class in hopes of getting my GPA up a few points, but it did the exact opposite. He will not help if you email him, very short in replies and clearly does not care to teach the course. Learning modules are useless. If you want to pass any quiz or exam your best bet is to memorize every detail of every reading.

I am a straight A student and I'm about to get the first D I have ever received in school. This online class was ridiculous. Tests and quizzes were over tiny, marginal details, the textbook was rarely used, and the discussion posting was impossible. I don't see the point in testing students on unimportant details and ignoring the big picture.

This professor is hilarious. Very sarcastic, dry humor. Lectures are entertaining. However, I found the tests VERY hard. He likes to test you on details. i.e., percentages, populations. AND those random stories in the margins of the textbook that no one reads? He loves to test you on those. Nevertheless, I got a B - messed up my straight A streak.

He is entertaining in class, but extremely unapproachable. I tried to get help from him, but he never responded to my e-mails and was never there during office hours. Overall, he is the worst teacher I have had at KSU.

If you are expecting an easy A or B THINK AGAIN. The tests are difficult. I read every single bit of material he offered to study for the exams and never got higher than a C on any of the tests. I wouldn't recommend him at all.

Very entertaining professor, however he does very little to help you in class.Class sizes are HUGE & there's little personal communication.He takes ONLY 3 test grades.If you do not test well,this is not the class for you.It is a lecture based course,so prepare for long speeches.Don't miss class often;he shows a lot of movies that are on the exams.

The class isnt easy but not hard. 3 tests & they are your only grades. however, he is very helpful, knowledgeable and he makes class funny. i should end up with a b. He is a very good professor and i highly recommend him.

Really nice guy and has a great sense of humor. My only problem is the tests. For some unknown reason he likes to focus on the most random of things instead of the bulk of the material. In the chapter we will have one page on a topic and he will barely discuss it in class and it will be on the test alot instead of focusing on the major stuff.
Loved this class. Professor is hilarious. Take if you can!! Insanely easy, just go to class and read the readings. No need to read the book.

His lectures are hilarious, and it made the class very relatable. I learned SO much in this class! It was very eye-opening. The labs are sort of a pain, but if you take notes and go to the exam review sessions, you will do great! I'd recommend him for sure.

An easy A, if you follow his instructions. Attend class every day, take notes, and be sure to attend the exam review because he will TELL YOU EXACTLY WHAT TO STUDY. Lectures are entertaining (he's very funny) and he uses real world examples to illustrate concepts. However, be warned that he is NOT flexible when it comes to policy.

Do NOT take his online course unless you're fanatical about keeping up with due dates, material, and don't have a chance of something coming up. I missed a couple of quizzes due to hospital stays with my daughter, and then an exam due to a wreck that left her in a trauma unit, and couldn't make any of it up.  Much more personable in a classroom.

Good professor. Very intelligent & may seem stern at times, but he's very helpful in regard to what is due when and the guidelines behind each assignment (also very detailed in the course syllabus). 16 Quizzes & 5 Tests. 3 quizzes are dropped and your lowest test grade is dropped. Extra credit opportunity. Buy the book. Enjoyed this course.

IT WAS AWFUL. I had more readings in his class than in my 4000 level class.  The quizzes did not reflect the content of the reading material, but instead asked nit picky questions that were sometimes confusing. If you want to make an A, don't take his online class. He was also rude and a bit of a smart ass in email responses.

This teacher is AWESOME! You'll learn tons of interesting stuff in his class, and his tests are pretty straight forward. The questions all come from your reading and class lectures. I highly recommend him!

Took for 1101/1102. Pay attention - take plenty of detailed notes - tests are specific but not hard at all for regular attendees. He's a funny and very knowledgeable man, and his lectures on his doctoral work at Penn State are fascinating.

He has a good sense of humor. Yes, he lectures from the powerpoint but he adds comments or stories to make it interesting. Attendance isn't mandatory, but the majority of the test questions come from the lectures. DO YOUR LABS! He asks VERY specific lab questions on the test. Be sure to study! He's a very chill guy. Would take him again.

Laposata is great at lecturing. He adds funny things in his powerpoints to help you grasp concepts. His tests are not very easy, but if you pay attention, do the review, and read your book, you'll be fine. If you want to learn, he's a great professor.
This is a great class and a solid professor.  Learned a lot - he pushed us and was a bit of a hardass.  Go to class and pay attention, read the text and you will do fine.

He's ok. If you want an A. This is NOT the way to go. Took him for 1101 in class... made a D (my 1st grade lower than a b..ever!. I decided to give it another chance for 1102 online.... Wrong! another D... His class is more about understanding the material instead of just reading it.

This guy is so useless. I took him for an online class so I could get coursework done over the summer. I took the final exam two days ago and I am so glad that I am done with him. He was rude and unhelpful. He showed no interest in helping me to understand the material. DO NOT TAKE HIM !!!

Easy class. Alot of reading. I wouldn't reccommend during summer if you have a social life. If you participate in the discussions you can get an A as long as you make B's on test. Quizzes are tricky, but not hard. Overall alot of good information . great for those who like to read. If your a good student you will have no problems.

There was a lot of material covered in one test and the questions on his test were very specific. If you did not study the very specific information and pay close attention to all the material in a film, it was difficult to make the grade you wanted.

Had the same online class they did. Not sure why they thought it was hard. yes 1 ppt had a ton of pages BUT it was split up into more than 1 quiz. He supplies guide for quiz. fill it out get A on quiz use for test. open book/note. not hard at all. the reason he didn't reply to ?s b/c same ?s asked over and over. be truthful about ppt. READ PEOPLE!

This professor is not the best, to say the least.  I took the course online, and it was so much reading that didn't make sense.  The powerpoints were 60-90 pages, and all the quizzes were designed to trick you.  Then the discussions were long, you hasd to go through 1000 posts and post something every hour or he'll fail you.

Tests are easy content-wise but very specific and there's a ridiculous amount of stuff covered in one test. Online-readings, Chapters from the book, In-class lectures and videos, Labs (including intro's and procedure). I worked my butt off for a B and I'm an A student.

the class is easy just study the powerpoints and read the outside readings. forget about asking questions because he gets frustrated with any question you ask. He is extremely rude and can make you feel as small as an ant sometimes. If you get an 89.9 you get a B dont even think about talking to him about it because he wont give you the time of day

I took 1102 online and it was pretty ridiculous. Instead of sending announcements, he puts them in the discussion board and expects you to go through the 1,000 weekly discussions to find his. Will not help you or explain anything. Tests are open book and notes obviously, but they are extremely tricky. Don't recommend even though I wound up with a B

This professor is the worst professor I ever had.  I had him for an online course and although I will get a B in the course, I could not stand the professor or the course.  If you like a very liberal and egotistical professor then take him.  He is full of himself and there is no room for you to have an opinion because it will go against you.  Avoid

This isn't a hard or demanding class! Just pay attention and take notes if you need to. Make sure you read what he assigns outside of class. Lecture is entertaining enough and the material is certainly relevant, no matter what you're studying or what you're interested in.

I took 1102 online.  Several quizzes a week with discussions.  I expect to get an A in the class.  So easy.  Everything is open books or notes.  So hard not to get an A on all tests, etc.  I gave him a 3 for helpfulness b/c we are in college and he expects you to read instructions.  Some people asked the same ?'s. He gets frustrated as did I.
loved this teacher! i learned so much from him; i got a 97-103 on all exams. take notes and do required reading and you will do great. im taking him for 1102! :)

I loved this teacher. He's very funny and class is enjoyable. Labs are not graded but there will be test questions about them. Come to class and take notes straight from the powerpoint and you will do fine. Also be sure to read the textbook chapters because there will be test questions. My favorite class so far in college. Definitely recommend.
His class is easy if you just show up and take good notes.  He makes things easy to understand and his tests aren't too hard either.

He really knows the subject well, and can be pretty funny sometimes, but lectures are long and usually without relief. Attendance not mandatory, but test questions are derived directly from lecture and he doesn't post notes online. A great deal of outside reading required. No need to do he labs, just read and study them.

this professor is awesome!! he knows what he's teaching! i had no clue about enviormental science and now i feel like i learned something. Go to class, take notes and you will do well on test! He makes the lectures very fun and interesting!!!

Lots of reading!!!Uses sources other than the text, but u still have some of the text to read. Mand. participation in discussions that have to take place over a period of time. Lots of work but cool class if u have the time. I took it online.

This is the WORST class I have taken at KSU. Yeah, he cracks jokes, but the problem I have is that when you ask for help, you dont get it. I sat in a class with 200 students and I promise only 15 -45 PASSED!!! The problem was that his tests are out of 120, not 100, but he didnt explain HOW to calculate your grade until the third test.

This class kept my attention throughout the semester. You MUST attend class if you plan on getting an A in the end. Tests are not hard if you pay attention and know/understand the material. Questions come from the book, videos & outside readings, but majorly from in-class notes.
i took this class online. it was more work that any other online class i've taken. i enjoyed the discussions, but that was pretty much it. i don't feel like i learned anything.

Took the online class, and I don't recommend it. I assumed, it being online, we would have a few discussions and quizzes. Instead, two quizzes every week and mandatory participation in discussions throughout the semester. Spent more time working for this class than my upper division classes for my major. Not worth it, don't take this class.

Make sure you come to class and take notes.  Tests are from notes, labs, behind the stories in the textbook.  There are only 4 tests.  Right now I have a B in the class and I am not a science person.  I am taking sci 1102 online that he is teaching next semester.

Professor Laposata is very funny and entertaining. His tests are a little random, but perfectly fair if you attended class. I put minimal effort into this class and recieved a strong B. If you go to class, pay attention, and take good notes, then the only studying you should have to do is the study guide the night before a test and you'll do fine.

Great professor but when it comes to tests, not so great. Went to class everyday, took notes, but failed EVERY test....His tests are on stupid stuff throughout the powerpoints he talks about. Great guy but terrible class.

This is a fairly easy class. Must be in class take notes. Test questions come from notes and "Behind the Story" stories in book.  Study those and you will do just fine. I would recommend this Professor. I am taking him for SCI1102 next semester!

I have no idea about in his in class course, but his online course is RIDICULOUS! The reading for this course is more than all 4 of my other courses combine! I am a fast reader and don't mind reading, but we had to read appox 500pgs for just unit 1. There are 4 units! You cannot catch up once you are behind!

I honestly would not recommend this professor. At first he's funny, but then he just comes off as cocky. The tests are short and hard to study for even with the study guide. I had to struggle to make a C in that class. He's a cool guy but your grade is the 3 tests and they are all very short multiple choice that mess with your mind really.

I promise you I fell in love with this teacher. 3 test, a couple extra credit questions, and an extra pre-test. That's your grade. Awesome teacher. Great sense of humor, but may come off as harsh to those who don't get it. He doesn't like slackers. If you are one prepare to get called out. Really cares. Loves what he teaches and you can tell!!

Good teacher. Go to class + take notes. Test questions are not meant to trick you if you read over the notes (pay attention to maps). There are also outside readings + a few questions from the book (advice: share). 3 tests and 1 extra credit quiz- thats all! If you try, you will do well. I made a 90, 92,+ 87.5, plus extra credit and got an A.

Go to class, take notes (be prepared, there are a lot), do outside readings and study. There are only three tests so make each one count. It's only hard if yo never go. Some of the test questions are a tad tedious. Being an English major, this class could have been more difficult for me, but was fairly enjoyable.

Awesome teacher, so funny! Easy class! Go to class write down all the powerpoint slides + a few notes, read the book and outside readings. Study notes a few time and you pretty much get an A. Tests are a good balance of questions. Don't talk in class he takes bonus questions away. Be sure to go to class or you won't get the grade. Highly Recommend!

In reference to his online class...Laposata's online class is quite difficult.  I have taken 4 online classes and this was by far the hardest for me.  A LOT of information on each test, and not good study guides to help you.  2 quizzes per week, a discussion per unit, and a unit exam every three weeks. This class is a lot of work, be warned!!

His class is very entertaining. This guy is VERY enthusiastic about what he does. He reminds me of Lucas from House. That being said, the material is simple but the tests are TOUGH. Go to class for notes!

He is a very entertaining lecturer. Do let it fool you though! His lectures are very detailed and you must take precise notes to study by. Tests are a nice mix of easy questions and very detailed questions. I did well in the class, but I did have to study like crazy.

The majority of these comments left by other students are reasonable. His lectures are just overwhelmingly detailed. He only teaches from powerpoints, but he does not post them online. Be prepared to hand-write or type your notes. Be prepared to study A LOT for each test. 1 out of 200 students makes a 100. The tests are NOT easy.

Great teacher. Knows what he is talking about. Show up to class, take notes, do the reading and pay attention to the movies and you will be successful.  I got 100 on second test so currently have an A.
Awesome class. Funny guy. Attendance not mandatory. Tests are kind of hard, but it's college, so study and you will be ok. 3 tests, that is the only grades.

LOVE LOVE LOVE. He doesn?t take attendance but I recommend you go because his PowerPoint?s are very informative and detailed. Makes science bearable, I hate science but look forward to going to his class every day. He breaks it down so you can understand! Tests are kind of hard, but I really recommend him!

Took his online SCI 1102 class and it's a LOT of work. He requires you to read a ton and his quiz/test questions are SUPER specific. A computer malfunction occurred during one of my tests and he was extremely unwilling to help or do anything about it. He gave me a zero for the test which resulted in taking my A down to a D for the class.

Material was extremely easy, tests weren't hard if you showed up to class and took pretty extensive notes. Appreciated the fact that attendance had no weight on grades - it was just three tests and a pretest that could get you some extra credit for if you showed up to take it. Teacher was laid back and amusing in class, but annoying one-on-one.

Pretty interesting class. Mr. Laposata is funny and full of interesting stuff. The tests are somewhat hard, but if you study the study guide and pay attention in class, you'll do fine. He posts large powerpoint slides online and tests on notes, videos, and online readings.
Pretty easy class if you go to class and take notes. Dont bother buying the book.

Took his online 1102 class and really enjoyed it. Two quizzes a week, 5 tests including the final, and you get to drop your 3 lowest of 16 quizzes and lowest test grade. Also have 4 discussions. Tests can be tricky but overall he's a great teacher with very timely email responses. Take him!!
Only 3 tests makes up the grade in the class; hard tests; need to attend class & take good notes if you want to pass; nice teacher
I didn't like him until I started paying attention. Now I learn and I imagine that he's Jerry Seinfeld! He looks and dresses and acts like him. I enjoy this professor and his class.

I have never been one interested in science, but he makes me actually want to come to his class. His lectures keep you interested. you need to come to class for the notes! no mandatory attendance, but strongly recommended to get a good grade. As long as you study the notes he gives in class, you will do great! TAKE HIS CLASS! :)

He's funny and interesting to listen to. I was worried over the first test but I made a great grade! You don't need the text book but come to class and pay attention to the films he shows and the extra articles he posts online. I know he's married with kids but there are times when he is just plain adorable! I gave him a chili pepper :D

He was rather funny to listen to, and in class I felt that I had a good grasp on the material. But after studying for hours for each exam, I found myself looking at very particular questions that were difficult to answer even after all that studying (6 hours per exam--still a B). I wouldn't take him if you're in other, more important classes.

Excellent professor, very knowledgeable in his subject. Makes learning fun and easy, I learned quite a bit in his class. Will take the time to explain anything that is not clear. The three test thing isn't bad at all, sounds scary but it isn't. Don't leave on movie days, they're definitely on the test. Great class, will take him again if I can.

Excellent professor.  I loved the class.The only downfall is the limited grading structure: three tests.  If I had gotten one more question right, I would have had an A.  Either way, I would still recommend the class though; It revived my love of science, and now I am going to pursue a degree in a science-related field.

AWESOME Professor. DO NOT MISS CLASS! Entertaining, VERY funny, and brilliant. I loved him. I'd give him a hot pepper, too, if we were still allowed to. If you have EXCELLENT attendance, take Laposata!! (don't be scared of the 3 test rule, it works out in the end). He really is awesome. I got an A and I would definitely take him again if I could :)

Laposata is excellent. Yes, only 3 tests, but if you study the material, you will do fine. I was concerned that 2 B's on the test would scar me, but his grading system allows for a little surprise at the end (in my case, an A). Very animated, a pleasure to listen to, and interactive. Likes to answer questions. I HAVE NO COMPLAINTS. HE'S AWESOME!!:)

I should have know when i was told that there were only going to be 3 test that it was going to an almost impossible class. By the time i took the last test, i pretty much knew there was no hope to get anything but a D in the class. Attendance not mandatory and he's funny, it's the test thing that can KILL your grade, so only take him if you HAVEto
Great teacher, best science teacher I've ever had. Genuinely cares about material, sheds light on contradictory issues and gives you the facts. Study hard for the tests and attend class to get an A.
Knows what he's talking about. Brilliant. Fun class. Sarcastic. I didn't study for any tests and made B's on all of them. EASY but really informative. Makes you want to learn.

Class subjects were really interesting & he is incredibly knowledgeable about subject matter. His tests, on the other hand, are CRAZY hard.  Pay attention to the little side bar cases in the chapters as he asks questions like "what was the specimen used in the project in the little blue box at the beginning of chapter 7?" (just an example). STUDY!

Good teacher, bad tests, little homework. His material is mildly interesting if you care at all about science, but his tests are tricky and not always scientific questions, rather they're often questions just to see if you picked up specific details about a subject. Make sure you take very detailed notes if you want an A, so you must come to class
He is a pretty easy going guy.  His tests are pretty difficult so it is important to really study.  other then that i would recommend him.
Nice teacher, but crazy hard tests. Everyone always failed the tests or got a C. Gives NO opportunities for extra credit. Your grade is based off of tests only.
Great professor, only problem is not enough leyway in points. you got to be spot on to get an A

This professor right here is the bomb. Yeah he's challenging, but no one can break down and teach science like Dr. Laposata can. If you're a serious student that shows up to class most of the time, take him. Otherwise don't. He makes it clear that he's not there to play games. But he does really cares for the students that try. Awesome professor.

This guy scheduled the final for the "ONLINE" class "ON CAMPUS" during regular class hours and not finals week. I had to leave a presentation just to take it. NOT COOL. Tests are moderate with no study guides. Nitpicky on assignments too. $300 to take this online! What a waste. AVOID THIS ONLINE COURSE IF YOU VALUE YOUR TIME AND MONEY.

Do not buy the book, we never used it, waste of money. A lot of environmental propaganda is mixed in. Take really good notes because he asks very specific questions from them. When in a bad mood, he treats students like high schoolers. Just keep your head down, your mouth shut, and you'll do ok.
Sets you up for complete failure in this course, disrespectful, has no compassion for students.

Would recommend him although his tests are pretty tricky sometimes but I think compared to the other teachers he is the one to pick! You canNOT miss any days otherwise you've missed test questions even with video days. He puts just as many video questions on the test as he does material in notes.
Awful!...His tests are ridiculous! No class should be that hard....

This was my 2nd time taking Laposta. His whole class is based on lectures. You have 3 tests and if you miss a day then you've lost test answers. Go on movies days because he draws just as many questions from those along with the outside readings. You have to take notes because he does not provide them on WEB CT...

Although he states attendance is not mandatory, if you miss class you will miss answers on the tests. and since 3 tests are your ONLY! grades you will not do well. Go to class, PAY ATTENTION, study and you will have an A.  For those of you who don't do well on tests, find another teacher. NO extra credit. Funny guy, but not helpful, use classmates.

I loved this class! First off, he is so funny & will wake up sleeping students and call out people but in a really funny way. He teaches great & I learned a lot from his lectures. Tests are not hard as long as you do what he tells you; notes, textbook, outside readings & movies. I made an A. Great class, I recommend him.

Laposata was a funny guy. The tests are a little tricky but if you use the resources: textbook, outside readings, notes, and power points you should feel prepared. several movies which ARE ON THE TESTS. pretty cool guy though, he plays it fair, just don't expect pity.

Fun guy, but hard class! 3 tests, 40 mult ch questions. No attendance policy but make sure to go to class bc he doesn't post powerpoints online, but lectures are fun and engaging. and make sure to read the outside readings posted online and the chapter intros in the text bc he pulls a lot of test questions from them. posts study guides on WebCT too

Laposata is a great teacher. He does a great job keeping you engaged because he is a very dynamic speaker. This class is hard. You only get three tests and they are pretty challenging. No other grades. I would recommend him but you really have to show up and take good notes for an A.
he has teaching environmental science down to a science. (no pun intended)

Good professor. Make sure you attend every class because he doesn't put anything online. He covers the material very well, and most of the time he doesn't go till the end of clas. THere is a lot of material to remember for the test, but as long as you study, go to class (Especially on film days, you should get an A.

Laposata is so far the best professor I've had at KSU! His lectures are interesting and I learned more in this class than any other class I've taken. Expect to attend class, read case studies in the textbook, and online readings because they will be on the exams. Take him if you can. You won't regret it!

The best science teacher out of them all!! He's funny, interesting, and has a great style of teaching. His tests are very hard though. There are study guides and he is very willing to help, it's just hard tests. But I'm ok with them being a little harder since the class is actually interesting.

Knows his stuff and doesn't have any unfair policies or rules. You really couldn't ask for much clearer explanations of the material. As long as you do your homework (labs, reading) and don't mind taking down a lot of notes, you're in for an easy A, cause it's not a hard class. I got a B just because I was too lazy to put in a little extra effort.

He is a very smart guy! The whole class leads to global warming. If your not a believer before you will be after this class. The tests are a little harder then some people have refered to! You MUST go to class & do all the labs and readings. Very Interesting class.

Attendance isn't required but you should go anyways because test questions refer back to specific examples used in class. Make sure to do the labs and readings-they really are on the tests and don't leave early or miss movie day! He's a really good teacher. Sarcasm is eminent yet not always evident. Oh yeah on the test if he feels that the majority of the class was present!

Attendance isn't required but you should go anyways because test questions refer back to specific examples used in class. Make sure to do the labs and readings-they really are on the tests and don't leave on movie day! He's a really good teacher.

Great teacher and great person.  Sarcasm is eminent yet not always evident.  He keeps you listening and interested to uninteresting material.  Hammers the global warming.  Smart man.  Go to class and study a little for an A.

Very easy! come to class and thats all you need to do! and even though you don't have to turn in the labs definitely do them because he asks a lot of questions about them on the tests. 1st test easy, 2nd hard, 3rd easy, 4th easy!

All you have to do is go to class! real hard i know... He's a great teacher and makes sure you understand everything. Its not extemely easy but the tests are straight from the notes and everything in the class is straight forward. I made an A and i also didnt miss any classes... Recommended

Anyone who has ever had problems with this guy either hasn't come to class or just doesn't study. The study guides are very useful and he's pretty clear about what are on his tests. Just go to class and read the labs and case studies...you dont even really need the book. Probably one of the easiest professors you can take.

Great professor. Lays out scientific prinicples that are useful to any citizen instead of only to science majors. Tests are not hard unless you don't come to class, almost everything comes from lectures and labs.

Okay, so everyone wrote how easy and great he is... but it really is NOT that easy! The first test is easy, the second test is IMPOSSIBLE, and the third test is in the middle. He doesn't go over anything on the test and pays a lot of attention to things that are not on the test. DO THE LABS AND READ THE CASE STUDIES!

Great teacher; really goes into detail about the topics. Puts PDF's, extra readings, and study guides on line; review sessions before every test; would advise going to class just to make sure you understand everything; labs aren't graded but he pulls questions from them to put on the test; the final isn't comprehensive! GREAT TEACHER!!!

Excellent teacher. Always gave his attention to his students. I don't even like science but he made it so interesting and fun. He always responced to e-mails regarding the study guide, all you have to do is ask. He's not the type of teacher that you can just skip classes on. Come on people this is college and the real world. You cannot sleep 4-ever

He seems like a nice guy and gives out a test review before each test. But the test reviews have nothing to do with the tests...so they are pretty hard. You only have three tests grades and thats it...so only take him if you love science and plan on attending EVERY class.

For a class that was probably created to service the uncaring masses going into fields other than science, I learned more than I thought I would.  He gave great lectures and his exams fairly written.  You must attend class as much of the exam materials come straight from his lectures and films.  I will take him for 1102 if possible.

Laposata is a guy with a PHD that torments students that take SCI 1101/1102. He believes that because he has taken every single science class that all his students should be able to get an A in his class. His tests are a bit tricky so MEMORIZE everything from notes and movies. Other than that dont put up with him.

Class is not difficult but don't get sick! I missed an exam b/c I  was sick and had a doc note but he treated me like I missed it on purpose. Then for punishment the make-up was at the end of the semester with 10 essay questions instead of MC ...there wasn't even enough time to finish the make-up! Only 3 exams to complete grade nothing else!

HE is a great teacher, If you're a science major!!! He made test way too hard for people who are forced to take this class because the state said so! He never was clear as to what was on the test, just "study everything" I don't care about this crap, its not my major! He is funny but if your not a science major, do yourself a fav take somebody eles

Good guy. You really need to study to do well in this class. Be sure to attend ALL lectures and even movies because he takes a lot of test questions from them. Other then 3 tests, there are no other assignments.

Hardcore power point kinda guy.  Assigns readings and labs for homework.  Only read the ch. introductions and don't do the labs.  They take hours out of your life and he can't really ask you what your results were on the test.  Read over them though and be careful, he can be tricky.  Keep the book for 1102.

Very nice guy, if you just go to class and take good notes, the tests will be a breeze. Labs are online and you don't turn in anything from them, the tests just have about 5 questions from the labs...and he posts all the .pdf slides online before class so you can follow along. Take him, you won't regret it!

This class is just like his 1101. It is all you. He just teaches from his powerpoints. Go to class. take notes from lectures and movies he shows. read case studies before tests, online readings. and youll do good. Dont miss his lectures. 75% test based on them. 3 tests. no other points available. No Labs

A very nice professor, knows how to make lectures interesting. Three tests during the semester, each 45 questions, 5 of which are bonus. Gives you a guide before the test and also has a test review session, in case you have any questions. You don't have to read the entire textbook, just the case studies in it, and the power point info from class.

This guy is so mean!! I did all the labs and every bit of work he gave. I came to every class, but when I got the flu I got it the day of a test, so I emailed him the day after, and he wouldn't let me take the test and he gave me a zero because he said " the flu isn't a reasonable excuse to miss a test"! I dropped his class to keep from failing.
Just go to class and you wont even need to study for the tests. his exams are based on the examples he gives in his lectures. So going to class would be smart!

Very Good Teacher. I thought science was going to be my worst class, but it turned out to be the best and the most fun. I wish all classes were like his. Just come to class, take notes,study and when you take the test, there won't be anything "tricky". I got a "B" in the class but could have easily goten an "A" if I did the labs.
Great Work

This class is preety easy. As long as you come to the class, you won't have hard time getting a good grade. He is so funny, just make sure you don't fall  asleep cuz he'll have everyone in class stare until you wake up.
As long as you take notes and study powerpoints there is no reason not to make a good grade. Great sense of humor and made class enjoyable. I highly recommend.
Easy class, keeps it interesting. Just always show up for class, and look over labs/outside reading. You barely need a textbook at all, can easily share with someone.

I hate science, but i really liked his class. his lectures are really interesting and he is pretty funny. the tests are really simple as long as you study the lecture notes and the lab background. overall good teacher

VERY easy teacher, best for Science classes. The labs are not *really* required, he only checks the attendence for them and doesn't require a summary of them or anything. His lectures are entertaining, but stay along with the material and with what is in his powerpoints. The tests are easy, no studying required, book not even required, go to class.
No Comments

He was so entertaining, I loved this class.  He is so laid back and he shows really funny (sometimes gross) videos.  His powerpoints are interesting and he really knows what he is talking about.  Tests are multiple choice and easy as long as you come to class and pay attention.
Great class and his lectures were hilarious, go to class and take notes to get an A or B if not youll get a bad grade in the class.

He is hilarious. His ectures are not boring at all and he does them by powerpoint, so notes are easy to take. Go to class and take the notes, do the labs (lab quizes), and you will get an easy A or B! He is awesome and interesting.
Easy class as long as you go to class and get notes. Test werent bad. Good professor and helpful.
Tests were reallllly hard. he was cool tho. answered anything u needed answered

He has a lot of great info. to share BUT he does not  give good tests.  Tests inc. the most detailed reading assignments from book.  Very specific when it comes to quizzes and tests.  Arrive on time b/c he is very punctual.
No Comments
